verses.esv:
3   For still the vision awaits its appointed time;
    it hastens to the end—it will not lie.
  If it seems slow, wait for it;
    it will surely come; it will not delay.
verses.kjv: 3 For the vision is yet for an appointed time, but at the end it shall speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; because it will surely come, it will not tarry.
verses.niv: 3 For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.

verses.esv: 3:1 For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven:
verses.kjv: 1 To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
verses.niv: 1 There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under heaven:

verses.esv:
14   Wait for the LORD;
    be strong, and let your heart take courage;
    wait for the LORD!
verses.kjv: 14 Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
verses.niv: 14 Wait for the LORD; be strong and take heart and wait for the LORD.

verses.esv:
31   but they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength;
    they shall mount up with wings like eagles;
  they shall run and not be weary;
    they shall walk and not faint.
verses.kjv: 31 But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.niv: 31 but those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

verses.esv: 9 And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.
verses.kjv: 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.niv: 9 Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

verses.esv: 6 For there is a time and a way for everything, although man’s trouble lies heavy on him.
verses.kjv: 6 Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore the misery of man is great upon him.
verses.niv: 6 For there is a proper time and procedure for every matter, though a man's misery weighs heavily upon him.

verses.esv: 11 He has made everything beautiful in its time. Also, he has put eternity into man’s heart, yet so that he cannot find out what God has done from the beginning to the end.
verses.kjv: 11 He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.
verses.niv: 11 He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the hearts of men; yet they cannot fathom what God has done from beginning to end.

verses.esv:
25   The LORD is good to those who wait for him,
    to the soul who seeks him.
26   It is good that one should wait quietly
    for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.kjv: 25 The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him. 26 It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.niv: 25 The LORD is good to those whose hope is in him, to the one who seeks him; 26 it is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.

verses.esv: 8 But do not overlook this one fact, beloved, that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verses.kjv: 8 But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verses.niv: 8 But do not forget this one thing, dear friends: With the Lord a day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like a day.

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv:
15   My times are in your hand;
    rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors!
verses.kjv: 15 My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
verses.niv: 15 My times are in your hands; deliver me from my enemies and from those who pursue me.

verses.esv: 4 But when the fullness of time had come, God sent forth his Son, born of woman, born under the law,
verses.kjv: 4 But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,
verses.niv: 4 But when the time had fully come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under law,

verses.esv: 7 He said to them, “It is not for you to know times or seasons that the Father has fixed by his own authority.
verses.kjv: 7 And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.
verses.niv: 7 He said to them: "It is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.

verses.esv: 27 But he said, “What is impossible with man is possible with God.”
verses.kjv: 27 And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
verses.niv: 27 Jesus replied, "What is impossible with men is possible with God."

verses.esv: 14 Is anything too hard for the LORD? At the appointed time I will return to you, about this time next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”
verses.kjv: 14 Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.
verses.niv: 14 Is anything too hard for the LORD? I will return to you at the appointed time next year and Sarah will have a son."

verses.esv: 28 And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.
verses.kjv: 28 And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
verses.niv: 28 And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.

verses.esv: 6 For while we were still weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.
verses.kjv: 6 For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.
verses.niv: 6 You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly.

verses.esv:
7   But as for me, I will look to the LORD;
    I will wait for the God of my salvation;
    my God will hear me.
verses.kjv: 7 Therefore I will look unto the LORD; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
verses.niv: 7 But as for me, I watch in hope for the LORD, I wait for God my Savior; my God will hear me.

verses.esv:
7   Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him;
    fret not yourself over the one who prospers in his way,
    over the man who carries out evil devices!
verses.kjv: 7 Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
verses.niv: 7 Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

verses.esv:
3   Trust in the LORD, and do good;
    dwell in the land and befriend faithfulness.
4   Delight yourself in the LORD,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
verses.kjv: 3 Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed. 4 Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
verses.niv: 3 Trust in the LORD and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture. 4 Delight yourself in the LORD and he will give you the desires of your heart.

verses.esv: 6 Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always here.
verses.kjv: 6 Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.
verses.niv: 6 Therefore Jesus told them, "The right time for me has not yet come; for you any time is right.

verses.esv:
10   “Be still, and know that I am God.
    I will be exalted among the nations,
    I will be exalted in the earth!”
verses.kjv: 10 Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
verses.niv: 10 "Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth."

verses.esv: 8 But do not overlook this one fact, beloved, that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day. 9 The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance.
verses.kjv: 8 But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day. 9 The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
verses.niv: 8 But do not forget this one thing, dear friends: With the Lord a day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like a day. 9 The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. He is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance.

verses.esv: 12 so that you may not be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.kjv: 12 That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.niv: 12 We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

verses.esv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.kjv: 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
verses.niv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
